Html:
Currently the controls that support text allow the text alignment to be set with the exception of the NavigationPane control. This will be allowed in the NavigationPane in beta 2.

The question I have is if the RightToLeft property is set to true in a control should any text alignment you have set be overridden and automatically be set to right center?

The reason I ask this is the caption, footer and each individual button on a NavigationPane may have their text alignment set independently in beta 2. If you set RightToLeft to true any independent text alignment you have done will be set to right center.

Thanks,
scorn

I’m adding right to left support in beta 3. It will duplicate how the . Net label control behaves. Basically if set to true a right alignment of the text will actually be left and left alignment will be right. I’ve always found this more confusing than just setting the alignment but I think it is best to match what Microsoft has already done.
